<Text: Team roping
1:
--------------------
Text: Team roping:  The first roper is referred to as the "header", the person who ropes the front of the steer, usually around the horns, but it is also legal for the rope to go around the neck, or go around one horn and the nose resulting in what they call a "half head".
Triplets:<Team roping
2:
--------------------
Text: Team roping:  Once the steer is caught by one of the three legal head catches, the header must dally (wrap the rope around the rubber covered saddle horn) and use his horse to turn the steer to the left.
Triplets:<steer
3:
--------------------
Text: Team roping:  The second is the "heeler", who ropes the steer by its hind feet after the "header" has turned the steer, with a five-second penalty assessed to the end time if only one leg is caught.
Triplets:<Team roping
